titleStmt.title: A battaile fought betvveen a Presbyterian cock of the right breed, and a craven of the Independent breed. With the cravens desire, that the quarrell may be ended, either upon Tower-Hill, or at the narrow place turning up to Padington. Also the sad complaint the craven made to some of his friends at his death, that he could not be buryed, and intomb'd as Presbytery John was, he therefore only desires one of the beadles of Bride-Well to be his excequetor. With the Presbyterian cocks epistle to the heads-man.

notesStmt.note: "With a woodcut representing two cocks: 'Presbyterian John revived' and 'Independent Craven a dying'"--Thomason Catalogue.
Reproduction of the original in the British Library.
